title: Pelton's NBA offseason grades: Who aced their summer -- and who got the only 'F'
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by?

title: Sources: Harper cussed out Manfred in meeting
content: Bryce Harper told MLB commissioner Rob Manfred to "get the f--- out of our clubhouse" during a meeting with the Phillies about the game's economics, sources told ESPN.

title: Trimmed-down Doncic: My 'body looks better'
content: Luka Doncic said he took a "huge step" in improving his conditioning this summer, adding that his "whole body looks better."

title: Patterson says he's been released by Steelers
content: Cordarrelle Patterson took to social media Monday to announce that he has been released by the Pittsburgh Steelers.

title: Sources: Cowboys G Jones has broken neck bone
content: Cowboys guard Rob Jones will be out two to three months after breaking a bone in his neck Sunday at practice, sources told ESPN.

title: MLB Speedway Classic to break attendance mark
content: With more than 85,000 tickets sold, the MLB Speedway Classic between the Reds and Braves at Bristol Motor Speedway will break the single-game attendance record.

title: Fitzpatrick wants long-term stay with Dolphins
content: Dolphins safety Minkah Fitzpatrick said he would like to remain with the team long-term after agreeing to a revised contract this past weekend.

title: Ichiro shows funny side, joins CC, Wagner in HOF
content: Ichiro Suzuki's sense of humor was on full display Sunday, when he joined CC Sabathia, Billy Wagner, Dave Parker and Dick Allen in baseball's Hall of Fame.

title: 👀 Messi and wife caught on Coldplay 'kiss cam'
content: Lionel Messi attended the Coldplay concert on Sunday night at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami with his family.

title: Updated ranking of MLB's top 50 trade deadline candidates: New names added
content: Our running list of who could be traded has some big changes in the final few days before the July 31 deadline.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Yankees focused on pitching upgrades
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on July 31 approaches.

title: Can Ashton Jeanty deliver on the hype? Those who've watched his career have no doubt
content: Ashton Jeanty started turning heads as a 14-year-old in Naples, Italy. His coaches, teammates and even his opponents have been witnesses to his rise.

title: Who will start for the Browns and Colts in Week 1? We made QB battle predictions
content: We talked to sources to help project open QB1 races in Cleveland, Indianapolis, New Orleans and New York.

title: WNBA trades we want to see: Mabrey to Storm, Hines-Allen to Fever
content: Marina Mabrey, Aaliyah Edwards and Myisha Hines-Allen could be on the move before the WNBA trade deadline.

title: 'Everybody just died laughing': Teammates, opponents on what makes Ichiro a Hall of Fame icon
content: As a Mariners icon gets his Cooperstown call, teammates and opponents share what makes him 100% Hall of Fame worthy.

title: Pérez: What it was like to play with three 2025 HOFers
content: Eduardo Pérez believes this year's inductees are more than great players -- their hearts and characters stand out.

title: Don't stop believing: The inside story of how England won Euro 2025
content: Late heroics, Reggie the dog and a new team mantra. Here's the inside story of how England won the 2025 European Championship.

title: Cincy on the up after tight draw vs. Messi-less Miami
content: Cincinnati is looking like one of the league's best again after taking the fight to Miami, climbing the latest edition of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: Clay's Playbook: A game plan for your draft day
content: Mike Clay goes position by position and lays out a successful approach for 2025 fantasy football drafts.

title: UFC Abu Dhabi takeaways: Why Whittaker's loss is good for the middleweight division
content: What does Reinier de Ridder's win mean for the middleweight division? Brett Okamoto provides takeaways.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: All-SEC Final Four? 100 predictions, more at 100 days until women's hoops
content: From the biggest storylines to the top players to watch, we preview the 2025-26 women's basketball season.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: Woad, 21, wins Scottish Open in debut as pro
content: Two weeks ago, Lottie Woad was the world's No. 1 amateur. On Sunday, the 21-year-old Englishwoman became an LPGA Tour champion in her professional debut.

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

title: Reactions to MLB trade deadline deals
content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Why Liverpool still want Alexander Isak amid massive summer spending
content: Liverpool's pursuit of Alexander Isak amid a summer of big spending isn't about being better this season but about future-proofing the team so that they're ready for life beyond Mo Salah.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: "Very Disappointed": Trump Sets 10 To 12-Day Deadline For Ukraine Deal
content: US President Donald Trump said Monday he intends to shorten the 50-day deadline he gave Russian President Vladimir Putin to reach a deal that ends the three-year war in Ukraine, after Russia continued to bombard Ukrainian cities.

title: Actor Divya Spandana Files Complaint Over Online Abuse After Darshan Bail Case Post
content: Actor and former MP Divya Spandana aka Ramya has filed a formal complaint with the Karnataka State Women's Commission and the Bengaluru Police Commissioner after facing a barrage of online abuse, rape threats, and vulgar messages

title: "Pain Will Not Go, But...": Pahalgam Victim's Wife On Operation Mahadev
content: The pain will not go, but "some peace" will come to us, Aishanya Dwivedi, the wife of Jammu and Kashmir terror attack victim Shubham Dwivedi, told NDTV on the day the Army eliminated three three Pakistani terrorists in an encounter near Srinagar.

title: "My Friend Shashi Tharoor Not Allowed To Speak": BJP MP's Swipe At Congress
content: BJP leader Baijayant Jay Panda on Monday took a dig at the Congress, saying the party is not allowing its own member and noted orator Shashi Tharoor to speak in Lok Sabha.

title: Dalit Techie In Tamil Nadu Killed By Lover's Brother Who Opposed Inter-Caste Relationship
content: A 23-year-old Dalit techie from Chennai was allegedly murdered by his girlfriend's brother in Tirunelveli district, Tamil Nadu, today.

title: 155 Weapons, 1,652 Ammunition Recovered From 5 Manipur Districts: Police
content: Security forces in Manipur recovered 155 firearms and 1,652 rounds of ammunition during multiple operations conducted in the hill districts of Churachandpur, Kangpokpi, Pherzawl, Tengnoupal and Chandel districts over the past few days, police said.

title: Betrayal, Rs 2 Lakh Extortion: Bengaluru Techie's Bumble Date Turns Into Nightmare
content: A techie in Bengaluru matched with a woman on Bumble, and the two, after weeks of casual texting and video calls, decided to go on a date after a month.

title: "You'll Sit There For Next 20 Years": Amit Shah Slams Opposition In Parliament
content: Union minister Amit Shah slammed the Opposition in parliament today amid the heated debate on Operation Sindoor, when they raised questions on foreign minister S Jaishankar's assurance that the US had no role to play in the ceasefire.

title: Monsoon Rains 7% Above Normal But Uneven Across Regions: Weather Office Data
content: India has recorded seven per cent more rainfall than normal since the onset of the monsoon on June 1, but the seasonal showers have been unevenly distributed across states, according to India Meteorological Department (IMD) data.

title: IT Ministry Keeping Close Watch On Tata Consultancy Services' Layoffs Situation: Report
content: The IT Ministry is keeping a close watch on the developments after Tata Consultancy Services' (TCS) decision to lay off over 12,000 employees, according to sources.

title: Bengaluru Police Chief, Suspended Over Stampede That Killed 11, Reinstated
content: The suspension of Bengaluru police commissioner B Dayananda has been revoked by the Karnataka government today.

title: Tracked, Hunted In Less Than 3 Hours: A Detailed Timeline Of Op Mahadev
content: The security forces in Jammu and Kashmir avenged the Pahalgam attack today after hunting down the alleged mastermind, Suleiman Shah, alias Hashim Musa, in an encounter in Srinagar.

title: Now, Solutions To Public Complaints Only A WhatsApp Message Away In Hyderabad
content: If you are a resident of Hyderabad, registering a complaint to the authorities and getting your issue resolved is only a WhatsApp message away. Hyderabad district Collector on Monday launched a dedicated WhatsApp-based grievance redressal system

title: "Nothing Objectionable": Cleric Defends Remark On Samajwadi MP Dimple Yadav
content: Cleric Maulana Sajid Rashidi from Uttar Pradesh -- president of the All India Imam Association (AIIA) -- who triggered an uproar with his objectionable statement about Dimple Yadav, today doubled down on his remark.

title: Adani Total Gas Clocks 21% Rise In Operational Revenue In Q1
content: Adani Total Gas Ltd (ATGL) on Monday reported revenue from operations at Rs 1,491 crore in the April-June quarter (Q1 FY26).

title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree To "Immediate And Unconditional" Ceasefire
content: Thailand and Cambodia's leaders agreed to an "unconditional" ceasefire Monday, after five days of combat along their jungle-clad frontier that has killed at least 36 people

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 6 Live Updates: Union Home Minister Amit Shah To Address Lok Sabha Tuesday Noon
content: As the Lok Sabha debate on Operation Sindoor intensifies, Union Home Minister Amit Shah is scheduled to address the House at 12 noon on Tuesday.

title: Global Brokerage Firm Recommends Buying Adani Ports Stocks, Sets Target At...
content: Global financial company Cantor Fitzgerald has started tracking and giving investment advice on Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd (ADSEZ).

title: What Minister Ram Mohan Naidu Said In Parliament On Air India Crash, Technical Defects In Aircrafts
content: Commercial airlines in India have reported a total of 2,094 technical defects between 2021 and June 2025, Union Minister of Civil Aviation Ram Mohan Naidu informed the Rajya Sabha on Monday.

title: Air India Crash: Mother Donates Skin To 8-Month-Old For Grafting Surgery
content: For 8-month-old Dhyaansh, the youngest victim of the June 12 Air India plane crash, his mother not only turned a saviour when she rescued him from the on ground crash fire but also provided her skin for grafts to treat his deep burn wounds.

title: Only 3 of 190 nations which are part of UN opposed Op Sindoor, says Jaishankar - Top quotes
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar addressed the Lok Sabha regarding the government's response to the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor. He highlighted India's zero-tolerance stance on terrorism. Jaishankar mentioned global support received post-attack. He criticized past governments' inaction after 26/11. The minister also spoke about India's strengthened regional ties and engagement with the UN Security Council.

title: Cambodia–Thailand ceasefire: Trump takes credit; declares himself 'prez of peace'
content: US President Donald Trump claimed credit for brokering a ceasefire between Cambodia and Thailand, following deadly clashes along their disputed border. The truce, officially declared in Kuala Lumpur under Malaysian mediation, aims to halt the fighting that displaced thousands. While sporadic clashes persisted, Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet thanked Trump for his support.

title: Operation Mahadev: 'Pahalgam attack mastermind' among 3 terrorists killed
content: In Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, security forces neutralized three terrorists in an intense firefight near Dachigam National Park. The operation, dubbed "Operation Mahadev," follows reports linking the terrorists to the April 22 Pahalgam attack, where numerous tourists and a local resident were killed.

title: BJP's Panda takes a swipe at Cong with Tharoor mention - 'No one could stop him from ...'
content: During the Lok Sabha debate on Operation Sindoor, BJP leader Baijayant Panda criticized Congress, pointedly mentioning Shashi Tharoor. Panda suggested the discussion would be more engaging if Congress allowed its capable speakers, like Tharoor, to participate freely. He noted Tharoor's eloquence and expressed pleasure that he spoke in the national interest despite perceived restrictions from his own party leadership.

title: What is TCS' bench policy whose first 35-day cycle ended this month
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) employees face increased job insecurity as a new bench policy, limiting unallocated time to 35 days, takes effect. This coincides with TCS announcing plans to cut 12,000 jobs globally due to skill mismatches. The policy, criticized as 'inhumane,' requires upskilling and office presence during bench time, potentially impacting career growth and employment.

title: IND vs ENG: Geoffrey Boycott takes a swipe at Ben Stokes - 'There is no way...'
content: Geoffrey Boycott has criticized Ben Stokes and the England team for perceived poor sportsmanship during the Manchester Test's final day. Boycott questioned Stokes' decision to offer a handshake, suggesting Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar deserved the chance to complete their centuries. He also highlighted England's bowling deficiencies, noting that Stokes himself was their best bowler in both innings.

title: Asia Cup: India should not play cricket with Pakistan - Lok Sabha MP
content: Amidst ongoing tensions, Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Arvind Sawant has urged India to avoid playing cricket with Pakistan, particularly concerning the upcoming Asia Cup 2025. During a Lok Sabha debate, Sawant questioned the decision to halt war with Pakistan without reclaiming Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: Chinese company banned in US launches rival to Nvidia's most-advanced chip
content: Huawei's CloudMatrix 384, showcased at WAIC Shanghai, is emerging as a strong competitor to Nvidia's GB200 NVL72. Despite U.S. restrictions, Huawei is becoming a key Chinese AI chip supplier. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang acknowledged Huawei's progress and warned about the impact of U.S. curbs, suggesting Huawei could dominate if restrictions persist.

title: 'They trust others more than own ministers': Shah intervenes during EAM's speech to target oppn
content: During a Lok Sabha debate on Operation Sindoor, Union minister Amit Shah criticized the opposition for disrupting S Jaishankar's speech, alleging they trust foreign narratives more than Indian ministers. Jaishankar outlined India's firm response to the Pahalgam attack, including suspending the Indus Waters Treaty and reducing Pakistani High Commission staff.

title: 'At no stage in talks with US ... ': EAM shreds Trump’s 'trade' claim; explains ceasefire trigger
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar refuted Donald Trump's assertion that trade negotiations facilitated a ceasefire between India and Pakistan. Jaishankar clarified in Lok Sabha that no such linkage existed in discussions with the US. He also criticized the Congress party's past actions while highlighting the government's success in addressing terror sites and designating TRF as a global terrorist organization.

title: IND vs ENG: Ex-India cricketer slams Gambhir's tactics – 'Take a chill pill'
content: Sanjay Manjrekar has criticized Gautam Gambhir's coaching during the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, citing "poor tactics" and "questionable selections." Manjrekar disputes Gambhir's claim that Karun Nair wasn't dropped, emphasizing India's past losses under Gambhir's leadership. He attributes the team's fighting spirit to the players, not tactical decisions.

title: BlackRock to staff: You cannot carry your phones & laptops to China, instead ...
content: BlackRock is restricting employees' use of company-issued devices in China due to rising US-China tensions and data security concerns. Staff must now use temporary loaner phones and cannot use company laptops, reflecting broader anxieties about operating in China's complex regulatory environment. This follows incidents of Western business executives facing travel restrictions and stricter data security laws.

title: Patrick Mahomes’s wife Brittany, reacts to grandma Randi’s photo album featuring grandkids
content: Randi Mahomes, Patrick Mahomes' mother, recently shared heartwarming photos from "Grandi Camp 2025" with her grandkids, Sterling and Bronze. Brittany Mahomes reacted with love to the pictures of Randi spending quality time with the children.

title: ‘Halt all terminations…’: TCS layoffs prompt NITES to write to labour minister; what it said
content: TCS layoffs NITES, an IT union, has appealed to the Union labour minister regarding TCS's plan to cut over 12,000 jobs, deeming the dismissals unlawful and demanding immediate reinstatement of affected employees. The union also highlighted concerns about delayed onboarding practices and the significant increase in CEO compensation amidst these layoffs, urging accountability from TCS's leadership.

title: Chess | What did Divya say after becoming first Indian to win WC? Full details
content: Divya Deshmukh, with modest expectations, remarkably won the FIDE Women's World Cup 2025, securing a spot in the Candidates tournament and the World Cup title. This victory automatically granted her the Grandmaster title, bypassing the usual norm and rating requirements. Deshmukh defeated Koneru Humpy, becoming the fourth Indian woman to achieve Grandmaster status.

title: IND vs ENG : Stokes hits back at Jadeja and Washington - 'Ten more runs...'
content: England captain Ben Stokes expressed frustration after Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar declined his offer for a draw, prioritizing personal milestones over team strategy. Stokes aimed to protect his bowlers from potential injuries with a quick turnaround before the final Test.

title: 'Proud of young Divya': PM Modi congratulates 19-yo on becoming first Indian to win WC title
content: Nineteen-year-old Divya Deshmukh made history by becoming the first Indian woman to win the FIDE Women's World Cup, defeating Koneru Humpy in a tiebreak. The crucial match saw Koneru make inaccurate moves, ultimately benefiting Divya, who capitalised on the opportunity. PM Modi and President Murmu congratulated Deshmukh on her remarkable achievement.

title: Khabib Nurmagomedov shuts door on UFC return with honest message about fight life
content: Khabib Nurmagomedov has clarified that he will not return to fighting. He says preparing for a fight requires at least six months of dedicated training. Khabib retired after defeating Justin Gaethje in 2020, fulfilling a promise to his mother. Now, he focuses on coaching Islam Makhachev and his cousins. He has dismissed any possibility of a comeback to UFC.

title: Stock market at near two-month lows: Why are FIIs selling Indian stocks? Explained
content: Indian stock markets are experiencing a downturn, hitting near two-month lows as Nifty50 and Sensex drop over 2%. Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) are aggressively selling, driven by factors like a strengthening US dollar, uncertainty around a US trade deal, and Q1 earnings.

title: Exclusive | Washington's father hits out at selectors: 'One failure and he's dropped'
content: Washington Sundar's match-saving performance in the fourth Test against England has been lauded, but his father expresses concern over inconsistent opportunities. M Sundar highlights his son's past performances, including crucial knocks in Chennai and Ahmedabad, and questions the selection process. He emphasizes Washington's talent and calls for consistent chances across formats, citing instances of being dropped despite delivering impactful performances.

title: Look out world, India's chess youngsters are coming at you - hard
content: India's chess prodigies continue their reign as Divya Deshmukh, at 19, triumphs at the FIDE Women’s World Cup 2025, securing her Grandmaster title after defeating Koneru Humpy. This victory follows India's historic double gold at the 2024 Chess Olympiad and Gukesh D's World Championship win, marking a golden era for Indian chess with young talents dominating global competitions.

title: Ahan Shetty wraps up 'Border 2' shoot; farewell video with Varun Dhawan goes viral
content: Ahan Shetty completed filming 'Border 2', sharing an emotional farewell video with co-star Varun Dhawan. He expressed gratitude for the growth and memories on set. Calling Varun a mentor and brother, Ahan teased his next project. 'Border 2', directed by Anurag Singh, releases January 23, 2026.

title: 'They never asked how many enemy aircraft we shot down’ - Rajnath hits out at opposition
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh addressed the Lok Sabha. He criticized the opposition's line of questioning regarding Operation Sindoor. Singh stated their questions did not reflect national sentiment. He emphasized the success of the operation. He confirmed no Indian soldiers were harmed. Singh urged focus on national security. He cautioned against distracting from the morale of the armed forces.

title: Historic! 19-yo Divya crowned Women’s WC champion, becomes India’s 88th GM
content: In a stunning victory, 19-year-old Divya Deshmukh clinched the FIDE Women’s World Cup title, defeating India no. 1 Koneru Humpy in rapid tiebreaks in Batumi, Georgia. The 15th seed's remarkable performance saw her overcome formidable opponents. This triumph not only crowns her World Cup Champion but also secures her final Grandmaster norm.

title: Marcus Morris Sr: 'The wording is crazy' — brother & agent allege NBA star was targeted
content: NBA free agent Marcus Morris Sr. was arrested Sunday at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport on a charge of writing a check with insufficient funds, according to Broward County records. His twin brother, Markieff, and Morris’ agent are disputing the charge. Hours later, Markieff voiced his anger in a post on X, formerly known as Twitter.

title: Kinetic DX e-scooter launch marks return of legacy nameplate: Price, range, & more
content: Kinetic Engineering's EV arm, Kinetic Watts & Volts, has relaunched in India with the DX EV electric scooter, inspired by the Kinetic Honda DX. Available in two variants, DX and DX+, priced from Rs 1.12 lakh, deliveries begin in September 2025.

title: Op Sindoor: Gogoi leads oppn charge against govt in LS; asks ‘how terrorists reached Pahalgam?’
content: In Parliament, Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi challenged Defence Minister Rajnath Singh regarding the Pahalgam attack, questioning the government's failure to prevent it. Gogoi highlighted unanswered questions about the attack, which claimed 22 lives, and criticized the government's internal security measures.

title: Chess | Divya Deshmukh becomes India's 88th GM - full list of Grandmasters
content: Nineteen-year-old Divya Deshmukh secured the FIDE Women's World Cup in Batumi. She defeated Koneru Humpy in rapid tiebreaks. Divya started as the 15th seed and displayed remarkable skill. Her victory earned her the Grandmaster title. She is the fourth Indian woman to achieve this milestone. This win marks a significant moment in her career.

title: Mother gives skin to save baby: 8-month-old recovers after near-fatal burns in Ahmedabad crash
content: In a harrowing incident following the AI 171 airplane crash, eight-month-old Dhyaansh and his mother, Manisha, suffered severe burns. Manisha's courageous act of saving her child led to both enduring extensive treatment, including skin grafts for Dhyaansh. The dedicated medical team at KD Hospital provided specialized care, ensuring their recovery and eventual discharge, highlighting the strength of a mother's love and medical expertise.

title: Tears of joy! Divya Deshmukh breaks down after winning FIDE Women's World Cup - Watch
content: In a stunning upset, 19-year-old Divya Deshmukh clinched the FIDE Women’s World Cup title, defeating Koneru Humpy in rapid tiebreaks. This victory not only secured her the World Cup but also earned her final Grandmaster norm, making her the fourth Indian woman to achieve the prestigious GM title.

title: NHL’s sweethearts Connor McDavid and Lauren Kyle celebrate one year together
content: Connor McDavid and Lauren Kyle are celebrating their first wedding anniversary with romantic throwback photos from their dreamy Muskoka ceremony. The NHL star shared heartfelt moments on Instagram, giving fans a glimpse into their fairytale celebration. With NHL friends like Leon Draisaitl and Celeste Desjardins in attendance, the couple’s love story continues to capture hearts.

title: Monsoon session: Was Tharoor offered a chance to speak on Op Sindoor? What we know
content: Shashi Tharoor's silence on Operation Sindoor sparks debate. Despite leading a delegation after the Pahalgam attack, he declined to speak on the issue in Parliament. Gaurav Gogoi and K Suresh approached him, but Tharoor preferred discussing the Indian Ports Bill, 2025. His endorsement of the government's actions contrasts with the Congress party's stance.

title: All you need to know about Madhampatty Rangaraj’s secret wedding to Joy Crizildaa
content: Madhampatty Rangaraj, actor and chef, recently married fashion designer Joy Crizildaa. Joy is a stylist for Tamil film stars. She previously worked in television before entering fashion. News of her pregnancy came soon after the wedding. Joy was earlier married to director J. J. Frederick. Madhampatty Rangaraj was previously married to Shruti.

title: Arshdeep Singh teases England with 'ho gai teri balle balle' moves after Old Trafford draw
content: India celebrated a moral victory after drawing the fourth Test against England at Old Trafford, highlighted by a resilient batting performance. Pacer Arshdeep Singh, despite being sidelined with an injury, lifted team spirits. A video of him dancing, showing off his Bhangra moves up the stairs went viral, showcasing the team's positive energy.

title: Watch: Divya breaks down in tears, hugs mother after historic World Cup win
content: Divya Deshmukh, a 19-year-old chess prodigy, achieved a stunning victory at the FIDE Women’s World Cup, defeating Koneru Humpy in a thrilling tie-break. This triumph not only secured her the championship but also earned her the coveted Grandmaster title, making her India's fourth woman to reach this milestone.

title: 'Op Sindoor to resume if ... ': Rajnath tells LS how strikes rattled Pak; dismisses 'pressure' charge
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh addressed Parliament regarding Operation Sindoor, the retaliatory strike following the Pahalgam attack. He confirmed the operation successfully targeted terrorist infrastructure, eliminating over 100 individuals, and was paused after achieving its objectives, dismissing claims of external pressure. Singh highlighted India's effective defense systems in thwarting Pakistan's subsequent large-scale attack, ensuring no damage to Indian assets.

title: Divya Deshmukh wins Chess World Cup: How much prize money did she win?
content: In a stunning victory, 19-year-old Diya Deshmukh triumphed over Koneru Humpy at the FIDE Women’s World Cup in Georgia. Deshmukh's composed play under pressure secured her the title and also earned her the prestigious Grandmaster title, making her India's 88th Grandmaster and only the fourth Indian woman to achieve this feat.

title: Stock market crash: BSE Sensex down over 590 points - top 5 reasons for fall
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, extended their losing streak on Monday. While Nifty50 went below 24,650 intraday, BSE Sensex tanked over 700 points.

title: Exclusive! Karisma Kapoor not involved in Sunjay Kapur's 30,000 crore estate
content: Sources close to the Kapur family have confirmed that Karisma Kapoor has no involvement in the inheritance dispute following Sunjay Kapur's death. The actress is not seeking any share of his ₹30,000 crore estate, with her primary concern being the well-being of her children, who are the rightful heirs.

title: Injured Rishabh Pant shares major update after being ruled out
content: Rishabh Pant is ruled out of the final Test against England due to a foot fracture sustained during the fourth Test. Despite the injury, Pant displayed remarkable resilience, scoring a half-century. Coach Gautam Gambhir lauded Pant's character, emphasizing his contribution to the team's foundation. Pant expressed gratitude for the support and shared his recovery plans.

title: 'Switch off our economy?' High commissioner to UK schools journalist on Russian oil
content: Indian High Commissioner Vikram Doraiswami defended India's oil imports from Russia, highlighting the nation's position as the third-largest energy consumer importing over 80% of its needs. He questioned the feasibility of halting the economy and pointed out the hypocrisy of Western nations buying other resources from countries they restrict India from trading with.

title: Bihar SIR: SC asks EC to reconsider Aadhaar and election ID
content: The Supreme Court urged the Election Commission to consider Aadhaar and voter ID cards as valid identity proofs during Bihar's Special Intensive Revision. Petitioners, including ADR, raised concerns about the exercise's legality and potential disenfranchisement, alleging arbitrary practices and violations of constitutional rights. Despite the EC's claims of high voter participation, reports suggest irregularities and potential fraud in the process.

title: IND vs ENG: 'You're not in the battle' - Kevin Pietersen defends Ben Stokes
content: The drawn fourth Test at Old Trafford saw England captain Ben Stokes' frustration boil over as India declined his offer to end play early, with Jadeja and Sundar pursuing centuries. Stokes' actions drew criticism from commentators like Nasser Hussain and Manjrekar, who deemed his behavior 'spoiled.' However, Kevin Pietersen defended Stokes' emotional response, emphasizing the players' mindset and charged atmosphere.

title: TCS layoffs ‘biggest ever’: AI not to blame for ‘difficult’ decision?
content: TCS layoffs: India's IT sector is facing turbulence as TCS, the nation's largest IT firm, announces unprecedented layoffs impacting 2% of its workforce, primarily in middle to senior roles. CEO K Krithivasan cites skill mismatches, not AI, as the reason for this 'difficult decision.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Nusa, Fofana if Rodrygo move fails
content: al Nassr looking at marc cucurella and Antony . Liverpool could move for RB Leipzig forward Antonio Nusa or Lyon's Malick Fofana . rumours that the 24-year-old is their no. 1 option to replace Luis Daz .

title: Bucs rookie pass rusher Walker out for season
content: rookie edge rusher David Walker has a torn ACL and will miss the season . the 6-foot-2, 260-pound outside linebacker was expected to serve a backup role . he was a three-time All-American at Central Arkansas . coach Todd Bowles said he has to look at this like a redshirt year .

title: NBA execs debate the rookie class: Flagg runaway ROY? Biggest steal?
content: the 2025 draft has wrapped up, with the rookie class debuting at summer leagues and teams looking ahead to next season . we polled 20 anonymous executives and scouts, asking for their thoughts on the draft and what teams are expecting from their new faces .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Giants QB Dart has strong practice
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . follow the links below to learn everything we are seeing and hearing at camp .

title: Euro 2025 Talking Points: Best match, goal, player, Team of the Tournament
content: the Lionesses are back-to-back champions, but which players made a name for themselves on the biggest stage? Emily Keogh, Tom Hamilton, Beth Lindop, Julien Laurens and Sam Marsden have been on the ground in Switzerland this summer .

title: 'Immediate and unconditional' ceasefire: Thailand & Cambodia agree for truce
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Detentions, protests & identity: Bengal’s poll battle heats up
content: 10 Indian baby names with Celestial and Astral roots! Books that bring inner peace more than any therapist 10 must-have tropical and indoor plants for the living space Forever radiant Zeenat Aman inspires with every appearance Shravan special! South divas actress flaunt gajra 10 things about Neel Gai that many don't know about Sacred baby names inspired by Lord Shiva 10 things to know before getting a pet Oscar fish How to use Chameli or Jasmine for hair growth Why Sai Pallavi, Kangana Ranaut, and other celebs rejected fairness cream ads

title: Stakes too high at Spa to risk safety on wet-weather drama
content: the Belgium GP has been suspended after just one formation lap behind the safety car . rain fell over one of motor racing's most revered circuits midway through Sunday afternoon . the anthem was sung in heavy rain, although it seemed to be easing off by the time the scheduled 3 p.m. local start time approached .

title: Why did Justice Varma submit to in-house inquiry if it was contrary to Constitution, Supreme Court asks
content: The query came after senior advocate Kapil Sibal complained that the action taken by the Supreme Court at the time, including release of sensitive visual and audio materials showing ‘burnt currency’, “convicted” Justice Varma in the public eye

title: Private defence suppliers seek review of rules limiting ammunition procurement to public sector
content: A private defence manufacturer says if the MoD amends the existing rule to allow for open Request For Proposal to be issued to both public and private sector, it will provide a big boost to the private ammunition industry

title: Procedure to redress chemically contaminated sites gets legal teeth
content: The new rules are part of a process of “legally codifying” the process in place once contaminated sites were identified; under these rules, the district administration would prepare half-yearly reports on “suspected contaminated sites”

title: BRS, Sigachi victims’ kin flay delay in handing over bodies, ex-gratia
content: Harish Rao asks why details of total deaths, injured persons not announced even after a month of the mishap

title: Opposition questions government on security lapses which led to Pahalgam terror attack
content: Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi asks govt. to clarify claims made by U.S. President Trump that he used trade to bring about truce between India and Pakistan; Trinamool MP Kalyan Banerjee says no country supported India during the conflict

title:
Will Modi speak in North India about 
Rajendra Chola’s victorious expedition, asks  TNCC chief Selvaperunthagai
content: The TNCC president dares Mr. Modi to speak about installing a statue for Rajendra Chola in North India and the defeat he had meted out to the north Indian armies during his expedition

title: BJP MPs protest against Muslim cleric’s remarks on Samajwadi Party leader Dimple Yadav
content: Maulana Sajid Rashidi, the cleric, had criticised Ms. Yadav, wife of Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav, for visiting a mosque near the Parliament without covering her head

title: Three months after SC order, West Bengal government yet to pay DA dues of employees
content: DA arrears, unemployment and lack of jobs trigger fresh unrest in State; heavy police deployment fails to deter marchers

title: NIA submits reports on Jiribam killings, Manipur HC gives one month to file chargesheet
content: Last month, the court had said that it had been a considerable time since the incident and yet no chargesheet had been filed in the case in which six persons were abducted and later found dead

title: Gujarat tops July rankings in Centre’s PM-JANMAN tribal mission
content: The western State is home to five Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups — Kathodi, Kotwalia, Padhar, Siddi, and Kolgha; the government is focused on addressing development gaps through targeted delivery, said officials

title: Stray dogs and public safety: A humane reform rooted in progress

title: Six-year-old killed, two injured in school gate collapse in Jaisalmer
content: The concrete structure of the main gate had weakened after a vehicle hit it sometime ago; it collapsed under the impact of strong winds

title: ASHAs urges Kerala govt. to keep its promise by increasing honorarium
content: The strike by a section of ASHA workers in the State, demanding a hike in honorarium as well as a better pay package, has crossed 170 days.

title: Notices to 3.75 lakh property tax defaulters
content: As of January, 2025, 2.06 lakh property owners were still defaulters and their arrears added to ₹329.15 Crore

title: M.R. Ajith Kumar appointed Excise Commissioner
content: The decision comes in the wake of a controversy over Ajith Kumar using a tractor to travel in Sabarimala, an act disapproved by the Kerala High Court

title: Three drown in water-logged fields
content: While the dead bodies of two individuals were found on Sunday, a third dead body was recovered in the afternoon on Monday

title: CPI(M), Congress attempt to put BJP on the defensive over arrest of Keralite nuns in Chhattisgarh
content: BJP Kerala unit dispatches a delegation headed by State general secretary Anoop Antony to Chhattisgarh to secure the nuns’ early release.

title: With waste disposal system absent, historic Poompuhar beach turns into an eyesore
content: Many people who visit Poompuhar Art Gallery, which showcases artefacts inspired by the epic Silappathigaram, also go to the nearby beach which has turned into an eyesore

title: Services to be suspended in post offices in Tiruchi, Lalgudi regions on August 2
content: This is to implement upgraded digital system and facilitate data migration, system validations and configuration; the new system is expected to offer better user experience

title: TEDx Davangere receives overwhelming response
content: Organised with the theme, Awakening Intelligence: Spiritual, Emotional and Artificial, it sees the participation of nine distinct achievers

title: Action plan soon to develop Tirupati as tourist hub: Tourism Minister
content: Gandikota tourism project, which has been sanctioned under the Centre’s Special Assistance to States for Capital Investment scheme, is expected to be launched on August 1 by the Chief Minister, says Kandula Durgesh

title: HC directs NTRUHS to treat NEET-qualified A.P. domicile candidates as ‘local’
content: Court grants the interim relief after hearing two lunch motion petitions filed on behalf of 53 students who studied Intermediate outside A.P.

title: Limit visits to Tirumala once a year, Venkaiah Naidu urges VIPs
content: Citing space constraints and extended waiting times, he appeals for restraint and consideration from dignitaries in the interest of common pilgrims

title: Dasara celebrations to begin on September 22 at Indrakeeladri
content: The temple to hold 11 days Dasara Mahotsavams this year, large number of devotees from across Andhra Pradesh and other States, and even abroad are expected to attend the events, says temple EO

title: International Festival of Kutiyattam begins on July 29
content: The five-day festival, IFK-2025, celebrates 60 years of Kutiyattam at Kalamandalam. It will be held at Kalamandalam campus, Cheruthuruthy, from July 29 to August 2, 2025.

title: ‘Dog Babu’ issued residence certificate in Bihar’s SIR process, DM orders probe
content: The area Sub-Divisonal Magistrate submitted a report stating that the application for the ‘residential certificate was submitted with Aadhar card of a Delhi-based woman’; Patna District Magistrate says the certificate has been cancelled forthwith and assured the public that action will be taken against all guilty officials and employees

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Secretary directs APGENCO to fast-track power projects, improve efficiency
content: Vijayanand reviews thermal, hydel output; flags delays in procurement and manpower deployment; calls for weekly financial monitoring

title: Enactment of Advocates’ Protection Bill and establishment of SC Bench in South India discussed
content: The T.N. and Puducherry Bar Council delegation meets their counterparts at A.P. High Court to discuss on issues concerning the legal fraternity

title: Satheesan accepts Vellappally’s challenge to go into political exile if the UDF fails to score an emphatic win in the 2026 Assembly polls
content: Leader of the Opposition said there was no personal quarrel with the SNDP Yogam general secretary. “I respect Mr Natesan’s age and stature. I also respect the chair I occupy and the proud legacy of the office of the Leader of the Opposition. My office constrains me from responding in like to Mr. Natesan, who is at the cusp of reaching 90,” he said.

title: Koodathayi murder case: forensic surgeon testifies cyanide poisoning led to Roy Thomas’ death
content: The statement emerges as a significant development to strengthen the prosecution’s case which hinges on proving that the deaths were not accidental but the end of a planned series of murders
